results.title: Hundred penny box
results.creator_credit: Pieter Van Deusen, Leah Miller and Churchill Films
results.brief_description: An extraordinary moving story about Michael, his hundred year old great-great Aunt Dew, and his mother, and the “big ugly old box”. The box holds a small sack with a hundred pennies, each a memory of a year of Aunt Dew’s life. Michael likes to count the pennies and listen to the stories that each year evokes. When his mother, burdened by the care of a failing old lady who disrupts the order of her house, wants to get rid of the big ugly old box, Michael is fiercely defiant. His small boy understanding of Aunt Dew is vastly greater than his mother’s. Based on the book by Sharon Bell Mathis.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Pieter Van Deusen, Leah Miller and Churchill Films
results.description: An extraordinary moving story about Michael, his hundred year old great-great Aunt Dew, and his mother, and the “big ugly old box”. results.title: Antonia: a portrait of the woman
results.creator_credit: Jill Godmilow, Judy Collins and Phoenix Films
results.brief_description: Presents a portrait of Antonia Brico, who in the 1930s established an international reputation as an accomplished orchestra conductor. Today she teaches conducting and piano in Denver, while leading the Brico Symphony, a community orchestra which she founded.

results.title: The Art of the potter
results.creator_credit: David Outerbridge, Sidney Reichman and Phoenix Films
results.brief_description: This film presents the work of English potter Bernard Leach and Japanese potter Shoji hamada. Shows each potter demonstrating and discussing his craft, beginning with the digging of clay through to its firing in a kiln. Suitable for Upper Secondary students.

results.title: Robert Frost's The death of the hired man
results.creator_credit: Jeanne Collachla and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: An adaptation of Robert Frost’s narrative poem of the same title about an aged and no longer productive hired man, who returns to live on a couple’s farm. The film captures the couple’s apprehension over the fate of the proud, homeless man amid scenes depciting early 20th century farm life in New England.

results.title: Another kind of music
results.creator_credit: Glen Salzman, Rebecca Yates and Fruits and Roots
results.brief_description: The story of four people from very different backgrounds, who are drawn together by their love of music. This simple story-line based around reggae music is designed to stimulate ideas on multiculturalism by emphaszing positive contributions of different cultures.

results.title: Like you, like me: see what I feel
results.creator_credit: Alan P. Sloan and Encyclopaedia Britannica Educational Corporation
results.brief_description: An animated film which dramatises how a child copes with blindness. Designed to encourage discussion of attitudes toward the blind and to show that a blind or visually impaired child can do many things that other children do.
